page.description: Find out what references and is referenced by a component using the *[ui:Show dependencies for this component...]* tool.

discussion.p: The *[ui:Show dependencies for this component...]* tool in the Web Projects Control Panel can be used to find out what components (e.g. Grid, UX, etc) reference a component as well as the components that are referenced by a component.
To open the tool, select a component on the Web Projects Control Panel. Then, right-click and select *[ui:Show dependencies for this component...]* from the context menu.

description.p: This will diplay the *[ui:Dependency Tree]* dialog with two lists: *[ui:Called by]* and *[ui:Calls]*.
The *[ui:Called by]* section shows a list a all components that reference the current component (the name of the current component is shown in double quotes in the dialog title bar.)
The *[ui:Calls]* section shows a list of all components referenced by the current component.

While in this dialog, you can select a component in the *[ui:Called by]* or *[ui:Calls]* section for editing. Simply select the component and click the *[ui:Edit component]* link below the respective lists. You can also view the dependencies for a component by clicking the *[ui:Show dependencies for selected component]* link.
